item.title: Designing for the First 5 Seconds
item.description:
People decide to stay in the first five seconds. Clarity beats cleverness in that window.

One headline, one action, one promise. Then deliver on it without interruption.

Earn the second five seconds, and the rest gets easy.

item.title: The Trust Ledger
item.description:
Keep the system small enough to see. When every step is visible, the next decision is easy.

A tiny review catches big drift. Five minutes now saves an hour later.

Clarity is a feature. The first line should survive a scan and still be true.

item.title: A Small Manifesto for Quiet Interfaces
item.description:
News readers are built for flow: scan, select, dive, return. In a world of infinite scrolling and decorative chrome, the calm interface is a radical choice.

This blog is an experiment in restraint: no popups, no attention traps, just clean type and a fast way in and out.

When interfaces are quiet, content feels louder. It lets your thoughts meet the text without fighting the UI.

So today, here’s the manifesto: give the reader a path. Make the path reliable. Let the words do the work.
